Abstract: This autobiographical exploration delves into the multifaceted career of a clinical psychologist specializing in alcohol research, with a particular focus on alcohol use disorder (AUD). The narrative outlines the journey from doctoral training, emphasizing the acquisition of specialized knowledge and skills essential for understanding and treating AUD. It highlights the significance of mentoring in shaping a research-oriented career, fostering the development of future psychologists. The role of journal editing in advancing the field of alcohol studies is discussed, showcasing the importance of disseminating research findings to both academic and clinical audiences. Engagement with professional societies is presented as a cornerstone for networking, collaboration, and staying abreast of the latest developments in the field. This account not only reflects on personal achievements and contributions to the field of psychology but also serves as an inspiration for aspiring psychologists aiming to make a meaningful impact in the realm of alcohol research and treatment.
